byline.original: By KATIE BENNER and MATT APUZZO
byline.contributor: Katie Benner reported from Riverside, Calif., and Matt Apuzzo from Washington.

lead_paragraph: A court hearing set for Tuesday was canceled in the Justice Department’s bid to gain access to phone data in the San Bernardino mass shooting inquiry.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Will Try to Open Phone Without Apple
headline.main: U.S. Says It May Not Need Apple’s Help to Unlock iPhone

snippet: A court hearing set for Tuesday was canceled in the Justice Department’s bid to gain access to phone data in the San Bernardino mass shooting inquiry.
abstract: Justice Dept says that it will attempt to open iPhone used by gunman Syed Rizwan Farook in San Bernardino, Calif, terrorist attack without assistance from Apple; latest court filing reveals outside party might be able to possibly unlock phone instead, move that could provide at least temporary reprieve from looming clash with Apple in debate over privacy and security.
